text:
Hey community!
As I have moved recently as a HS dev freelancer I am going to start some open source projects and tuts on different platforms and formats.
Does Twitch (or any stream like) sound interesting to you?
Tagging some to start the conversation :wink:
<@U2H3TT8F2> <@UD53A9UUR> <@U7SL518D6>
Excited to see what you produce!
Excited to see where this chapter of your career takes you Gonzalo, I think this sounds like an awesome idea.
Reach out when you are ready and maybe i can help with cross promoting on the community
<@U7ADCU3BM> has a polly for you!

:tada: I am excited too!
Hope it works, still looking for a good way to work towards open-source :relaxed:

Well you’re welcome to contribute to any of the HS owned open source projects, as well as  obviously community ones you and I have collaborated on in the past.

There’s also always the fun of starting something new.

Happy to chat with you on my past experience leading open source projects in this community,

Thanks Jon!
I have some ideas to work on, and definetly helping current open projects is gonna be a path to follow :wink:
embarrassingly, I have never used twitch

well, honestly the dev thing in twitch is just opening and didn't grow that much yet. Tho it seems interesting to me.
And if you are not in to videogames is not much more to watch honestly :smile:
old man
`ok, boomer`
:rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
really appreciate <@UD53A9UUR> :raised_hands:

<@U7ADCU3BM> I've looked into this a few times, and personally I think YouTube live/VOD is a better fit. It's also not too hard or expensive to make your own restream service using NGINX-RTMP on a DigitalOcean droplet to go live on both at the same time... just sayin :wink:
<@UD53A9UUR> gotta tune into some of my virtual darts matches ;)

you are right, although I like the idea of interactive and more relaxed sessions tbh.
Good catch, will check on that too!
gotta start somewhere :wink:

YouTube live does support the interactive/live sessions with chat(with stickers and ways to support the YouTubers) and whatnot, and your streams can be saved as videos for your channel which have the visibility of YouTube.

I won’t pretend to know though whether Twitch or YouTube is better for live-coding stuff, I just know they’re not so dissimilar now days.
what if we prefer to learn via Betamax Tapes or VHS? :smile:

I've been a part of a Twitch "IRL" channel for a few years now playing webcam darts, and it's really hard to gain a following if you're not also on other platforms. Plus if you're a Twitch partner your content has to be exclusive to a degree in order to keep your monetization. So basically if you're looking to grow an audience, you're better off on another platform, whereas if you already have a following on something like Twitter, IG, or YouTube then Twitch is a cool place to hang out and interact with your established audience (almost like a private discord server/slack in video form).
Also <@U7ADCU3BM> be sure to check out Alpha Gaming and EposVox on YouTube, they're gold mines for the tech side of streaming.
thanks for your insights!
<@U2H3TT8F2> Am sorry but I don't need to fill the gap of IE with VHS :smile:
